name: Holiday Inn Express New York City Fifth Ave

reviews.text: Where to start really! This really was a great hotel which I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.text: The location is great for the stereotypical NYC Tourist. Five minute walk from Rockefellar, MoMA. Ten minutes from Empire State, Times Square and a short taxi drive down to the World Trade Centre and Liberty & Ellis Island cruises. Not only this there are some great places to eat and get souvenirs seconds from the hotel.
reviews.title: See you next time. It was great.

reviews.text: The staff were are great. Cleaners always said good morning and did a great job. Receptionists were lovely and were very "in-the-know".
reviews.title: Great value, great location
Five stays within 12 months...Need I say more?
reviews.text: The breakfast was pretty basic but brilliant to fill you up. Cereal, small selection of hot things, cakes etc and hot and cold drinks - all great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the room goes it was very small, but clean and everything was in good working order. Good bathroom, great TV & channels, good quality beds and nice view.
reviews.title: Room small, but water was hot, with good pressure.

reviews.text: My husband, two year old daughter, and I recently spent two nights at this hotel. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were very clean and comfortable,a bit on the small side but we made due even with a toddler to share the space with. The front desk staff was very helpful, even getting us cartons of milk in the middle of the night when our little one decided she couldn't sleep. Having breakfast included was a huge plus for us. We were able to get a table easily both mornings and all enjoyed a great, filling, breakfast.
reviews.title: Clean and close to everything!

reviews.text: We booked using our Priority Club points, so I can't comment on the value for the rental fee - I have no idea now much this room would have cost had we paid cash. That being said, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location and faciltiy; been here twice; will look to stay again!"

reviews.text: Such a convenient location; rooms very clean; nice meal. Can't beat it!
reviews.title: Clean comfortable room. Great location.

reviews.text: Only problem is there are two elevators for nearly 20 floors; a very slow system;
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.text: Located in the best area for business and pleasure. Very clean. Room seemed small at first, but we had plenty of room. Showers had good water pressure, unlike the Marriott chain or Hilton chain. Room was quiet, even though we were located right next to the elevator. We were looking for a place to shower and sleep while attending our conference, this was ideal. Breakfast was exceptional but be prepared for the crowd - free food always draws an interesting crowd. The staff was friendly, check in was fast and courteous. Checked our bags for a few hours of shopping before we left the city. Definitely on my list of places to stay again.
reviews.title: Great Location for sightseeing and shopping

reviews.text: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Holiday Inn Express 5th Avenue and found having a separate living area (with sofa bed) excellent. The bathroom was small, but functional. The room was at the back of the hotel, so quiet - which is unusual in NY. As other reviews comment, you cannot beat the location - and especially if you are in NY in winter you will be pleased that so much is within easy walking distance. The breakfasts in the lobby are bountiful, and prepared by staff who take care. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel if visiting NY for a few days - as you will make the most of every day!
reviews.title: One bedroom suites are good
Excellent location and helpful staff.
reviews.text: This was our first time in New York and this was an excellent location - on 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. We felt safe walking the streets in the area at night time. Walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre. We also walked from the hotel to Central Park, Bloomingdales and Macys. The rooms are typical Holiday Inn Express - Small, but clean and comfortable. The lifts were quick and we were never delayed. We had no problems with the complimentary breakfast or the seating (eventhough the area was small). The staff were always very friendly and helpful. There is a pizza/korean takeaway across the road from the hotel if you are too tired to go out for the night and you want to bring food back to the room (it also sells bottles of wine).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had flown from Ireland to JFK and used Airlink (www.airlinknyc.com) for transport to the hotel from JFK Airport (they collected us on a bus from the airport to Central Station where they used minibuses to take us to our hotel, they also collected us from the hotel to the airport, without any problems). Just one thing we found was that while children under 12 years are free on the bigger Airlink buses they are not free on the smaller Airlink minibus which return you to the airport, but the driver would not charge us the fee for our daughter. We will stay at this hotel again on our next trip to NYC and we will also use Airlink for transport to/from the airport. We booked the Airlink just outside the door of JFK Airport and the rooms we booked on holiday-inn.com
reviews.title: Great accommodation, great location, highly recommended

likes.disliked: — No view but wasn't bothered about view

reviews.title: Great Hotel for location and clean rooms
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel based on the reviews it had got here on Trip Advisor, from all the hotels we had read reviews for, this always seemed to have far more good reviews then bad. We went for a 5 night stay over Valentines and booked our trip through BA.com. This hotel and accommodation is very good value for money, its location is fantastic! The rooms were clean, tidy and were cleaned and had fresh linen every day. The lobby for breakfast was small and we didn't use it as there are two Starbucks within 2 mins from the hotel which we chose to use!! The location is unbeatable, its mins from Times Square, Rockafellar Plaza, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Building to name but a few. The only time we used the subway was to go to Brooklyn so we could walk back across the bridge. We walked to Central Park from the hotel also and that took about 20-30 mins but its a fab walk along Fifth Ave past all the fab shops and you don't even notice the time! If you are not fussed about having 5 star luxury and want a hotel that is good value for money, clean, tidy, comfortable, friendly and mins away from all the sights then I would recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

reviews.title: Very good location
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, just off 5th ave and 2 blocks from time square. The hotel is very clean and tidy and the breakfast is great although not alot of space to eat. Staff were friendly and attentive. Rooms were very clean and not as small as I thought they would be.
Small, cramped, overrun with students/backpacks. No lobby to speak of, understaffed at the desk. Room was decent. Will try hard not to stay here again.
reviews.title: Good for students and tourists.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn Express for 7 nights. We loved it. We do not have anything negative to say. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My room was very clean. The bed was comfortable. The free internet is a plus!! The buffet style breakfast is good. I could eat the cinnamon rolls every day! They are great. If you are looking for a good place to stay while in NYC, in my opinion, this is it!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: This hotel is a great place to stay for a trip to New York City. It's close enough to walk to many attractions. The staff was great, helpful, friendly and accomodating. The breakfast was a great bonus for NYC. Saved us money and got us off to a healthy start. The rooms are a bit small but not for NY standards. Very clean, nice bath, slim line TV. Quiet even.
reviews.title: What a great stay in NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at this Holiday Inn. Location is fantastic. We were greeted warmly, allowed early check in and later departure because we are Priority members. Rooms are clean and staff is very responsive. This hotel is BUSY, but front desk staff is always polite and knowledgable. Breakfast is generous.
reviews.title: No disappointments here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I don't appreciate from this hotel chain (not this property's fault) is the game playing about room rates. Two months prior to our arrival, rates were $350 a night. We book at another property and keep trying to get into Fifth Ave. Finally, three days before arrival, we are in where we are in at around $200. Big hassles then trying to get out of other property.
reviews.title: Friendly and accommodating Hotel in NYC
Wonderful Hotel and Location
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed here, and it was wonderful. The location couldn't be better. The members of staff were friendly and helpful. They always greeted us as we came back to the hotel or left to go out, and always did whatever they could to answer a question or honor a request.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small, but this is New York City. Our view was of an office building next door. But the room itself was great. The bed was very comfortable, the new flat screen TV was great and had a lot of channels. Also, the wireless internet worked great on our iPod Touch. The bathroom was a bit small, but I expected that. However, it was a nicely decorated bathroom with great towels.
reviews.title: Nothing More You Can Ask For!
much better than expected--will definitely return, ASAP!
reviews.text: There is a business center in the lower level of the hotel with 2 computers. There is a printer available; however, I did not use it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast looked great, but we did not eat there. It was very crowded each day we were there, so we had breakfast at a market a couple of doors down (great omlettes for a great price).
reviews.title: Beware of the Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk did add a nice touch for us since I'm a Priority Club member and used points for this stay. They had 2 bottles of water and a little package of Pepperidge Farm cookies with a Thank You note on the desk. It just goes to show that a thoughtful gesture goes a long way with a customer.
reviews.title: Clean and Friendly

reviews.text: Hotel was great location. Very effective air con (it was hot and humid in NYC at the time). Slept really well (didn't want to leave the room at times!). LCD TV with hundreds of channels, good size room. Clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel.

likes.liked: — The location and comfort of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff. Pleasant and tasty free breakfast in morning. 5 mins walk to Times Square, seconds from 5th Avenue.
reviews.title: Great location, very central

likes.disliked: — Not enough room in the reception area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What more could you want?
reviews.title: Excellent stay and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Here's why I rated it as I did....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tom Griffiths
reviews.title: smokey rooms

reviews.text: This hotel was an all-around "winner" in my eyes..... I really can't think of anything to negatively criticize it on.
reviews.title: very impressed all-around

reviews.text: The location is really great (just a block or two East of the craziness that is Times Square /Broadway).
reviews.title: Do Not take Room 101 or 102 Noisy Beyond Belief
Great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and very presentable on the outside and in.
Check-in was great......simple, quick, and pleasant. The elevator was fairly high speed, so it didn't take much time to get to the top floor (where our room was).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had two double beds and was very spacious, especially considering we're in NY. There was a nice desk/ work space and a conveniently large dresser and closet. The beds were very comfortable and all linens and decor was attractive & up to date. The washroom was clean, large enough, had ample water pressure and an eco-friendly 'low flow' toilet to save water (and reduce some of the flushing noise).
reviews.title: Tiny rooms - could barely walk by the beds

reviews.text: Live in NJ and work in city. Book often in the city and first try here. Was given room across from desk on first floor. Room had coat check tickets all over window sill. Had to call maintenance for TV clicker who said only one they had and I had to return to front desk in AM. No bathtub. Noise all night so poor sleep day before a Board meeting. Front desk didn't care. Charged me $470 for this bliss. Breakfast was set up in AM which was only saving grace. Not great - but at least they had coffee.
reviews.title: Run from this place.

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a girls getaway to the Big Apple for some shopping and Broadway shows...it was perfect...there were 4 girls to one room and we managed great...the room, although on the smaller side, was very clean, with everything we needed...called for extra towels one morning and they were delivered within a few minutes....the buffet breakfast was great...good varaiety and was included in the room price which made an already great deal even better...the location was absolutely perfect...extremely central to all the major sites and shopping areas...the staff were absolutley wonderful...always smiling and so friendly & helpful....would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as a package weekend break and were not disappointed! The location was ideal for our requirements being within walking distances of the main attractions. The hotel offered friendly and helpful service, clean rooms and a wide ranging buffet style breakfast. The bathroom had a bath as well as a shower, which was useful as was the free internet service.
reviews.title: Ideal for weekend in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two minor negatives are (1) the rooms are not big but are perfectly adequate to rest your head after a busy day and (2) limited seating at breakfast can be a problem. However, we ate fairly early and managed to get a table without any problems.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We called to book our room at the Holiday Inn Express after we'd had enough of killing cockroaches at our cheaper 'boutique' hotel. When we arrived the next morning and explained the situation (including the fact that our luggage had been missing for three days), Michael at the front desk found us a room right away.
reviews.title: Good location

aka: Holiday Inn Express New York City Fifth Ave Hotel
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue Hotel. Built in 2005, the hotel features include complimentary American breakfast, free in-room wireless high-speed internet access and free local phone calls.The Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue is a brand new modern, twenty-two story high rise hotel centrally located within close proximity to numerous restaurants, museums, 5th Ave shopping and the following attractions: Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Broadway Theatre District and the Jacob Javits Convention Center. We are also a short cab ride away from Madison Square Garden, Macy's, Lord and Taylor, American Girl, the Modern Museum of Art, NYU, FIT, and the Chelsea Piers. Stay with us if you are in town to see the Today Show which is right up the street from us, as is the David Letterman Show and Good Morning America. Visit New York City, and Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue Hotel.
